books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Jessica Simpson with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.contributor: by Jessica Simpson with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.description: The singer, actress and fashion designer discloses times of success, trauma and addiction. Read by Jessica Simpson. 11 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OPEN BOOK

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university. Read by Julia Whelan. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Michael T Osterholm and Mark Olshaker
books.contributor: by Michael T. Osterholm and Mark Olshaker
books.description: How epidemics and pandemics can disrupt everyday life and world order. Read by Jamie Renell. 11 hours, 6 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DEADLIEST ENEMY

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”  Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: John M. Barry
books.description: An overview of the 1918 flu epidemic and cautionary tale for similar kinds of large-scale outbreaks. Read by Scott Brick. 19 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE GREAT INFLUENZA

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice. Read by the author. 7 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIERS

books.author: Lori Gottlieb
books.description: A psychotherapist becomes another therapist’s patient. Read by Brittany Pressley. 14 hours, 21 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MAYBE YOU SHOULD TALK TO SOMEONE

books.author: Stephen Fry
books.description: Whimsical retelling of Greek myths. Read by the author. 15 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MYTHOS

books.author: Ronan Farrow
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter details some surveillance and intimidation tactics used to pressure journalists and elude consequences by certain wealthy and connected men. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CATCH AND KILL

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS

books.author: Ann M Martin
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina
books.description: Karen wants to prove her neighbor is a witch named Morbidda Destiny.
books.title: BABY-SITTERS LITTLE SISTER: KAREN'S WITCH

books.author: Shannon Hale
books.contributor: by Shannon Hale. Illustrated by LeUyen Pham

books.contributor: by FGTeeV. Illustrated by Miguel Díaz Rivas
books.description: Four kids battle their way through video games to rescue Moomy and Duddy.
books.title: FGTEEV PRESENTS: INTO THE GAME!

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Callie becomes the stage manager for her middle school’s production of "Moon Over Mississippi."

books.description: The super spy alligators Mango and Brash are awash in crimes to investigate.

books.description: Raina experiences braces, boy troubles and other plagues of the sixth grade.

books.title: DEMON SLAYER: KIMETSU NO YAIBA, VOL. 11

books.description: Raina is stuck in the back seat between her younger brother and sister for a weeklong road trip in this family memoir.

books.description: In a world full of of people who can develop superpowers, Izuku Midoriya is just a “normal” teenager. Will a chance encounter with a superhero change his fate? Most likely!
